findings.title: H01. Requirements Violation
findings.description: In the requirements section of the documentation, it is initially specified that "All processes should be executed on-chain." However, the allocation calculation serves as an exception, being performed off-chain. Additionally, the documentation specifies that “funds should be accessible to withdraw at any time” while it is not possible for the users to withdraw their funds when the contract is on pause.

findings.title: M01. Non-Finalized Code - Requirements Violation
findings.description: The code should not reference draft contracts, which may be changed in the future.

findings.title: Data Consistency
findings.description: Smart contract data should be consistent all over the data flow.

findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the customer.

findings.title: Style Guide Violation
findings.description: The provided projects should follow the official guidelines.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: Inconsistencies between implementation and requirements were found, including off-chain allocation calculation and inaccessible funds during contract pause.

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: The environment variables are not consistently set across different environments.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: Functions and state variables visibility should be set explicitly. Visibility levels should be specified consciously.
